name: hurl
content:

to throw something with a lot of force, usually in an angry or violent way: hurl something across something In a fit of temper he hurled the book across the room.hurl something at someone Youths hurled stones at the soldiers.

hurl abuse, insults, etc. at someone
to shout insults or rude language at someone angrily: I wasn't going to stand there while he hurled abuse at me!

a stick with a wide, flat oval end, used in the sport of hurling (= an Irish team game similar to hockey): He flicked the ball up with his hurl and hit it goalwards. He has accumulated a large collection of hurls, including some fine older ones. Synonym
